column4: Claims for compensation from GM for faulty switch rise 30 percent
column5: WASHINGTON The number of claims of injury and death linked to a faulty ignition switch in General Motors Co cars rose 30 percent last week to 1 130  according to a report on Monday from the lawyer overseeing a program set up to compensate accident victims.

column4: Fitch Places Hewlett-Packard's 'A-' IDR on Rating Watch Negative
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  October 06 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has placed the ratings of  Hewlett-Packard Company (HP) and its wholly-owned subsidiary Electronic Data  Systems LLC (EDS) on Rating Watch Negative. The placement on Negative Watch  follows HP's announced separation into two companies  consisting of HP  Enterprise (HPE) and HP Inc. (HPI). The tax-free spin-off to shareholders is  expected to be completed by the end of fiscal year (FY) 2015 (Oct
